title: Lockpicking Minigame
description: Lockpicking minigame that can be used to unlock doors, chest, etc.
longDescription:
This project showcases how to implement a lockpicking minigame similar to the one seen in popular RPG games. It fully supports the use of gamepads, as it can be experienced in the demo, and it is highly customizable (e.g., the difficulty of the locks, the size of the proximity regions relative to the sweet spot size, etc.).

The demo has several pre-defined key binds to interact with the environment and for the lockpicking process, as listed below:

Input (K&M / Gamepad):

  • To start lockpicking, press E / Gamepad Face Button Left on the door.
  • Once the lockpicking has started, press the E / Gamepad Face Button Bottom to try to unlock, and use the mouse / Gamepad Left Thumbstick to change the lockpick position.
  • Press the Tab / Gamepad Face Button Right to exit the lockpicking process.
  • While not lockpicking, press Z / Gamepad Face Button Top to lock the door with a random difficulty and refresh the number of lockpicks that you have.

However, through the Enhanced Input system, all of the keybinds can be easily changed by the user.

The documentation provided should have sufficient information for the user to customize the vast majority of the lockpicking settings, as well as the basics for the user to develop its very own lockpicking style (i.e., lock, housing and lockpicks).
technicalDetails:
Features

  • Allows players to engage on a lockpicking minigame to unlock doors, chests, etc.
  • It is fully compatible with gamepads as shown in the demo, including feedback on the gamepad when lockpicking.
  • Users may design their own locks to implement in the framework provided. Instructions and a link to the Blender file used is provided in the Documentation.


Asset Statistics

Audio Assets: 4 sounds, 4 sound cues and 1 sound attenuation

Blueprints: 4 and

Materials: 3 materials and 5 material instances

Textures: 16

Actor components: 2

Static Meshes: 7

Demo Assets: 4 blueprints, 12 input-related, 1 level and 1 texture


Other information

Network Replicated: No

Supported Development Platforms: Windows: Yes / Mac: Not tested
